Using mobile data and SIM is Present
Select the following box if the phone is rooted and the app is a system app (refer to help for details)
Phone is rooted and app installed as system app.

To register a device: 1) Register/login on the Cacophonometer website. 2) Create a Group with that user. 3) Enter the Group name in the field above and press Register. Multiple devices can be in the same group.
Select the following box if you want to use the test server (you will need to re-register the phone)

Setting the GPS location is very useful for keeping track of the phone. Press the button below to set the location (the phone settings will open if GPS needs to be turned on) and once the location is displayed press the disable GPS button to SAVE POWER.

Thank you for installing the Cacophonometer app.

The app will automatically make audio recordings every hour (and additional recordings around dawn and dusk) and upload them to the Cacophony Project data server. This will allow us to monitor the birdsong near your phone. 

 To use this app you will first need to register on the data server and create a group. You will then enter the group name into this app. 

 You are then ready to press the 'Setup Device' button to configure the app:
1) Register the phone with your group,
2) Select if you are using a SIM/Mobile data connection or not,
3) Get the GPS location,

And for Experts only 
4) Decide on the server and 
5) Select if you are using 'root' access. This is only needed if you are using a solar panel AND your phone uses Android 4.2 or above. It allows the app to turn airplane (flight) mode on and off to save power. 

 After you have finished the setup, go back to the main screen and press the 'REFRESH' button to check that the app can connect to the server - if all is ok you will see ticks next to the various App Vitals, and a 'Device ID' number. You can then press the 'START TEST RECORDING' button. This will make a 5 second recording and send it to the server. 

 If you are using a solar panel then it is important to turn off and/or remove everything on your phone that might consume power e.g. email accounts that sync with the server, set screen brightness and timeout to a minimum, turn off bluetooth and GPS. It might be a good idea to disable as many of the apps that came with the phone. 

 Once recordings have been sent to the server (once every 12 hours) you will be able to log back in and listen to them - as will anyone who has your password!

We intend to perform automatic machine analysis of all recordings rather than have a human listen to each recording. We also expect to implement a system to automatically remove any speech present in the recordings.

If you believe you have inadvertently recorded a private conversation, please use the delete function on the server to remove it. 

 Thank you again for supporting The Cacophony Project
 https://cacophony.org.nz/
